|vendor_id = 0411 |device_id = 004b |subvendor_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |subdevice_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |id_string = <!-- PnP ID string --> |windosid = <!-- Windows ID, Leave blank for none --> |fcc_id = QDS-BRCM1005 |icid = <!-- Industry Canada ID, Leave blank for none --> |boardid = <!-- Board ID --> |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id --> |oui = 00:07:40
|chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4333;BCM4333KPB, CA0326 P10, 700084SA J; |chip2 = Broadcom;BCM4306;BCM4306KFB, HS0336 P20, 705345 E; |chip3 = Broadcom;BCM2050; |chip4 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; -->
|antconn = MC |antenna = <!-- Antenna type --> |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11b/g |802.11g = 54 |802.11b = 11 |wififreq = 2.4 |receive_sens = <!-- Receive sensitivity --> |transmit_power = <!-- Transmit power -->

|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = 12/16/2002 |estreldate = 03/2004 |estprice = 49.99 |upc = 747464108711 |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = B0000A3H0T |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = Taiwan
|powledcolor = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |connactled = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |spdledcolor = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |leddupcolor = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimmin = <!-- Size of device --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device -->
}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== Per a disassembled unit... *"MIB100GS_V01" and "109-501-4500" is silkscreened on the WiFi module (soldered to the Mini PCI retaining clips...). *"WUBB105GM_V01", "109-501-6700", and a date code of '''0335''' is silkscreened on the bridge board. **There are two unpopulated headers - J25 ([http://www.seattlewireless.net/WAP54G likely including CPU data lines], can connect to external UART) - 20 pin and J1 - 12 pin *The MC connector is attached to a breakout board ('''Buffalo''' logo, "AR2C-BA", and '''0334''' date code SSed on it) w/ another antenna and a U.FL connector connecting it to the radio. *"WL280ANT_V05", "109-700-0201", and a date code of '''0336''' is silkscreened on the standalone antenna. This device has a coaxial power connector (w/ plastic sticker covering it) and a recessed unlabeled button.
According to [http://www.tomsguide.com/us/buffalo-technology-wliusbg54,review-185.html Tom's Hardware], the device is based on the BCM94333U reference design (BCM4333 + BCM4306+BCM2050).
Per [http://www.fatwallet.com/forums/hot-deals/315833/ this FatWallet forum thread], the retail price seems to have been $49.99.
[[Category:English Documentation]]
